title: With Riot considering making Rylais a high damage CDR/Mana option

replies.body:
you want mobility creep? because thats how you get mobility creep.

mages with dot, short cooldown, and/or aoe abilities who are many right now, are using rylais to completely shut down champions without obscene amounts of mobility in their kits. if theyre really encouraging permaslows and make the item into an even better option for medium/long ranged mages who are already loaded with cc, then it will be impossible to play anything else but fizz, zed, yasuo and similar champions who can compensate for being slowed with long ranged hard gap closers.

Hell, they should just nerf the slow and make the item a situational defensive option.
I remember season 3 and four where AP champions weren't actually building perma slowing items and relied on their own kits to outplay their opponents.

It should really only be a major item for champs who lack consistent stickiness, like {{champion:8}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:68}}  and {{champion:50}}  because his root is god awful early. But I saw it on a Viktor yesterday, he wasn't amazing, but Rylais made it impossible for anyone without lots of MR unable to deal with him. I also saw it on Cass and I literally wanted to AFK because of it, but I didn't even with every bone in my body saying "FUCK THAT SHIT, GET YOUR MACHINE GUN SLOWS AWAY FROM ME"
Swain doesn't need rylai and never needed. Saying it like brother of Swain main.

sorry, but if an item makes you inescapable as an immobile champion, you'd be retarded not to build it. even if the case for swain not needing it could be proven, it still ignores the fact that it gives him an advantage. you cant ignore free advantages and expect to do your best. and yes... rylias slow is statistically free compared to its AP and health values.

Historically Swain needed RoA as fisrt item. Nothing changed after MYMU. But after tons of nerfs he strongly needs cdr, otherwise his ult takes forever to recharge. And there is no way yo buy Rylai before RoA or cdr. After that Swains buy Zhonia. So I don't see when you can buy Rylai.
you dont need cdr. I take CDR runes on him but thats because im bad. most good swain players are entirely uneffected by the ult CD nerfs because they dont ult at the wrong time

Neft Rylai and we can say goodbye to mages. Unless after update assassins will lose their ability to burst too.

The item would be fine if they just knocked some AP off of it. It has a niche it should be filling but it gives so much AP you sacrifice nothing for the survivability and utility it gives so it's core on everyone.

They are also shutting down champions without mobility even harder thou. {{champion:63}} vs {{champion:1}} used to be a skill match up. Brand had better range but he needed a skillshot to land his CC. Now he just clicks on you with his dot and while you are slowed to oblivion he can stun you and full combo from there.

Suuuuure, that's what's keeping the beginner champions in the gutter. Not red buff, not mallet, not IBG, it's the mid laner when you start playing ARAM after 20 minutes. 

You're also aware that Rylai's is part of why Fizz, Zed and Yas are so bad midlane, right? They can't burst you down nor can they get in range to click on you (and if they do, they can dodge like one ability.

ashe was the first champion who started the entire mobility creep in the game due to how ridiculously broken her permaslow used to be at the time.

riot started to make more champions with mobility, because the ones that have been existing werent able to deal with her permaslows anymore. and riots solution for every problem back then was releasing a new champion every two weeks.

rylai right now is doing exactly the same. people THINK that rylais counters mobility, when the item hits slower champions unproportionally harder than mobile champions. because while zed, fizz, ekko, riven and other very mobile skirmishers and assassins are affected by the permaslow, they have at least some way to compensate for the fact that theyre slowed.

slows dont stop dashes, jumps and blinks. fizz can still trollpole in your face and follow with his q dash from long distance when hes slowed. riven is still going to bunnyhop around and dash with her e.

but immobile champions are entirely fucked by the constant passive slows. they might aswell be snared throghout an entire fight.

this means the fact that rylais is built everywhere and mages are permaslowing opponents, forces mobile picks since it invalidates the immobile champions.

Or so it sounded when Meddler chirped in to present 'em

I think RIOT should take...

option C: add slows to every item in the game so that Rylai's isn't the best item item the game.

Make it a 3-hit effect like Vel'Koz (perhaps even with an autoattack refresh) to prevent chasers (like Cassi and Evelynn) from perma-slowing you. Abuse-cases like Vladimir would also struggle to trigger it in their first rotation (without using Sanguine Pool).

You could even make it not-trigger on applied DOTs (like Blaze, Noxious Blast, Deathfire, Malefic, Children of the Grave and Poison Trail), to (again) prevent perma-slows abuse-cases. It should still trigger on persistent AOEs (like Tormented Soil) and tethers (like Drain), and if the nerf to Singed is too significant then his trail could be made a persistent AOE instead of an applied DOT (or make it a persistent AOE that also applies a DOT, but the DOT doesn't do damage until after 1 second and exposure continually resets the timer).

I'm sorry, but that would make it incredibly weak for {{champion:82}}, which is part of the reason Malicious Metal doesn't want it to become a fully offensive item.  Can you even imagine how difficult it would be for {{champion:82}} to activate that slow?

His W would trigger it after 3 instances of damage, because it's a persistent AOE. His Q is a 3-hit effect already, and it applies spell effects. Depending on the stack timer, it could be triggered in 3 Siphons - so it would give Mordekaiser windows of up time and down time. 

Plus, Mordekaiser needs reworking any way.

Mordekaiser generally can't get in range for his W ticks to hit without getting an initial slow on the enemy.  I suppose with a Hextech Revolver it could work, but that would be 2 required items rather than just one.
